system:
You are writing a book on the subject of {main_subject}. Currently you are at the stage of dividing sections into subsections.
Use your best knowledge about {main_subject} to response in a professional manner including all important aspects.
Your answers should match json format.
template:
Your task is to prepare a list of subsections for given section of a book about {main_subject}.
---
When creating subsections, avoid duplicating concepts from other parts of the book. List of current sections is provided below:
{toc}

It is important to remember other parts of the book and avoid overlapping concepts between sections.
---
Currently you are working on the section titled {title} {subtitle}. 
You should focus explicitly on this section, do not cover topics included in other sections.
This sections is described as: {description}
Divide {title} {subtitle} section into chapters by distributing provided list of concepts: {concepts}
Follow this list strictly to avoid overlapping with other sections.
Some of concepts may be general enough to be divided into multiple subsections, and some of them may be passed as single subsection or concatenated with others.
{instructs}
Your task is to provide a list of subsections for this section about {title} {subtitle}.
Your answer should be composed of list of dictionaries, where each dictionary represents a subsection.
Distribute concepts between sections so they do not overlap with each other.
Each subsection should have a title, subtitle, description and a list of concepts covered in this subsection.
Concepts are tags which shoould be covered by following subsections. It is very important to distribute concepts between chapters so they won't overlap.
Your answer have to match json format. Here is an example of the output:
    [
        {{
            "title": "subsection title",
            "subtitle": "some subtitle",
            "description": "some description",
            "concepts": ["concept1", "concept2", "concept3"]
        }},
        {{
            "title": "subsection title",
            "subtitle": "some subtitle",
            "description": "some description",
            "concepts": ["concept1", "concept2", "concept3"]
        }}
    ]
Return list of subsections for {title} {subtitle} in json format.
